Articles.Content: What do i do when i play ksp with opengl and it gives me a black screen when i start it up

Does your GPU supports OpenGL?
It's a so dated rendering technique that I wouldn't be surprised if video-cards these days would never even heard of it.
i do have intel integrated hd graphics 3000 any alternatives?
Try updating your graphics driver, but if that does not work there is not much else you can do without replacing the graphics card, which is not an option on laptops.
how could any one gues i'm on a laptop XD
Integrated graphics cards are common in laptops. A few desktop motherboards have it too, put people generally stay away from those.
Intel HD 3000 supports OpenGL to the 3.1 version. Your game should start in OpenGl.

On 10/02/2016 at 3:27 AM, Evanitis said:

Does your GPU supports OpenGL?
It's a so dated rendering technique that I wouldn't be surprised if video-cards these days would never even heard of it.

Um, no. The current (4.5) spec was released in August 2014, and until everyone switches to Vulkan, OpenGL will continue to be the standard (and only) graphics API on any non-microsoft operating system. Every GPU in existence (if manufactured after ~1998) is supposed to support it.

That said, Unity3d + OpenGL on  Windows is unofficial/unsupported, so YMMV.

Edited February 12, 2016 by steve_v
